cause.description:
The College Democrats of America Women's Caucus is one of the official vote based caucus of College Democrats of America.
Since its 2006-2007 leadership, the caucus has taken an active role in social advocacy. Particularly, the CDA Women's Caucus launched the "ABCs of HPV" initiative, which created a national infrastructure of caucus representatives working with college based chapters to educate and advocate on behalf of young women and the impact of the HPV vaccine. See "whatisHPV.net" for more information.
To read more about the caucus, please feel free to visit http://www.collegedems.com/a/caucuses/communities/women/
We look forward to working toward the advancement and advocacy of young women across the nation this year.
Inquiries, Please contact Emily Brooks, Chair, at brookse@collegedems.com
Sincerely, 2007-2008 E Board
Emily Brooks, Chair, GWU Anna Koeppel, Vice Chair, Missouri- Columbia Monica Foskett, Communications, N. Illinois Lauren Elliott, Development, Ohio University Catherine Fontana, New Media, Albion
1. Young women should advocate on behalf of the personal, political, and social issues in the society surrounding them.
2. Young Democratic women across the nation should ally their beleifs toward the political advancement of their causes.
cause.mission: Work in alliance with the goals of College Democrats of America to promote women's advocacy and political activism
cause.name: College Democrats of America Women's Caucus
